title: Polar Etch-A-Sketch
description:
I set out to reimagine a common childhood toy in a world where a different, non-cartesian, coordinate system reigned supreme: the polar coordinate system.

This Etch-A-Sketch works differently than others: one knob moves the pointer around the center and the other knob moves the pointer toward and away from the center.

Ironically, drawing a circle is a breeze with this one, but nearly impossible with the original Etch-A-Sketch. And just as corner is easy with the original, two perpendicular lines are nearly impossible to draw here.

The familiar premise yet atypical affordances place this product in a speculative future, parallel to but divergent from our own.
